Package command

Interface ICommand<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddEventTagCommand, BookEventCommand, CancelBookingCommand, CancelEventCommand, CreateEventCommand, GetEventDirectionsCommand, ListConsumerBookingsCommand, ListEventBookingsCommand, ListEventReviewsCommand, ListEventsCommand, ListEventsMaxDistanceCommand, LoadAppStateCommand, LoginCommand, LogoutCommand, RegisterConsumerCommand, RegisterStaffCommand, ReviewEventCommand, SaveAppStateCommand, UpdateConsumerProfileCommand, UpdateProfileCommand, UpdateStaffProfileCommand
public interface ICommand<T>
ICommand is the interface implemented by all commands. This common interface allows the Controller to run any command using a single common method Controller.runCommand(ICommand). Every command must specify a type parameter, which is the command result type.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void execute​(Context context, IView view)
    This method should not be called directly outside of testing.
    T getResult()
    Get the result from the latest run of the command.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      void execute​(Context context, IView view)
      This method should not be called directly outside of testing. Normal usage is to create a command object and execute it by passing to Controller.runCommand(ICommand) instead.
      Parameters:
      context - object that provides access to global application state
      view - allows passing information to the user interface

    • getResult

      T getResult()
      Get the result from the latest run of the command.
      Returns:
      The command result (type varies by command) if successful and null or false otherwise.
